headline: VIDEO: GOP Rep. who voted to impeach Trump warns party in ‘troubled waters’
author: DML News App
sentences:
Host Chuck Todd posed the question, “Lauren Boebert, and Marjorie Taylor Green, and Paul Gosar, is that a different element than you’ve ever seen before?”
Upton replied, “I don’t think we’ve had as many folks in that sort of wing of the party elected as we have before, but I think they’re very popular back at home.”
Todd then pressed Upton to explain his answer further.

Warring factions within the Republican Party could push the GOP into ‘troubled waters’ with less than seven months until the November midterm elections, a retiring lawmaker said on Sunday.

We’re focused on the country first, and the policies.”
He continued, “Our problems are too big to fight among ourselves and think so small, and that’s exactly what we’re doing — putting this country first to solve our problems.”

On Sunday, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy commented a more positive outcome for the GOP come November.
Rep. Fred Upton (R-Mich.) was the fourth House GOP lawmaker to drop his re-election bid out of 10 who voted to impeach Donald Trump for the Capitol riot.
